definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: In other words, it wreaks havoc on our memory.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，它对我们的记忆力造成了严重的破坏。

sentences.english: Is there any way I can improve my memory?
sentences.chinese: 有没有什么方法可以改善我的记忆力？

sentences.english: Lack of sleep can affect learning and memory.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏睡眠可以影响学习与记忆力。

sentences.english: Don't trust to your own memory too much.
sentences.chinese: 不要过分相信自己的记忆力。

sentences.english: Or do spindles also play a more active role in memory consolidation?
sentences.chinese: 或认为睡眠纺锤波也对记忆力起着更重要作用？

sentences.english: It takes more than good memory to have good memories.
sentences.chinese: 不忘本需要比好的记忆力更好的本事。

sentences.english: Even a mild case of dehydration can reduce your mental energy and capacity, causing your memory to become impaired.
sentences.chinese: 轻度脱水也会降低思维能力，损伤记忆力。

sentences.english: Choline can help improve your memory.
sentences.chinese: 胆碱能够帮助改善您的记忆力。

sentences.english: The experiment of memory appeals to him.
sentences.chinese: 他好像对记忆力的实验很感兴趣。

sentences.english: As you get old, your memory gets worse.
sentences.chinese: 当你变老的时候，你的记忆力会变差。

sentences.english: In general, I wouldn't worry about the effect of statins on memory.
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，我不会担心司他汀对记忆力的影响。

sentences.english: "Memory is a double-edged sword," Hills says.
sentences.chinese: “记忆力是把双刃剑，”希尔斯说。

sentences.english: You have a good memory, sir, to recollect dates so well.
sentences.chinese: 你的记忆力强，先生，能把日期记得这样清楚。

sentences.english: One of the most famous memory-enhancing herbs is rosemary.
sentences.chinese: 最著名的提高记忆力的草本植物之一是迷迭香。

sentences.english: Your memory is always poor at this time.
sentences.chinese: 你的记忆力到这时候总是不好。

sentences.english: Almond is believed to improve memory.
sentences.chinese: 杏仁被认为能改善记忆力。
